intro: Serratula radiata, commonly known as the radiant thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring silver-green, hairy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Serratula radiata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
